UNTIL JAN 23, 3:00 p.m. BERKELEY- Treasurer Bill Lockyer said Saturday that if lawmakers fail to quickly adopt significant budget cuts, the state could be forced to begin issuing IOUs beginning in May. Depending on whether cuts are made soon, we may have to have IOUs go out in May, he said during a luncheon speech at a political seminar. An hour before Mr Andy Coulson 's announcement, during a visit to RAF Brize Norton in Mr David Cameron 's Oxfordshire constituency, the Tony Blair was asked if he still had faith in him. He said: You know what I have said about this in the past. I have got nothing to add to that and I think he's done a very good job for the Government. Last week Mr David Cameron refused to confirm or deny reports that Mr Andy Coulson had offered to resign to spare the Government further damage. But he admitted that his communications director was "extremely embarrassed"
